column4: hey guys, I cant seem to install/update anything I get message saying I need to run 'dpkg --configure -a' but that command freezes my machine, anyone know what I can do?
can you pastebin any error msgs you are getting?
maybe try this: dpkg -l | grep ^ii               I think thats it
what then? I get a bunch of info
I got the command wrong... hold on
dpkg -l | grep -v ^ii
I forgot the -v I think
what do I do with the output
pastebin it
http://paste.ubuntu.com/59954/
so, its mysql thats causing the problem
how do I solve it? my mysql server seems to be running fine though...
maybe remove mysql, and try to reinstall?  I dunno..
how do I remove it? I can't use dpkg for anything
sudo dpkg --force-depends --purge (or --remove) mysql-server-5.0
have you gotten things working?
yea seems fine thanks a lot
did you just reinstall mysql?
yea seemed to do the trick
cool
